009package Ch04_Filters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
015import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
016
017import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * ImageJ plugin implementing a simple linear 3Ã—3 "box" filter. First a duplicate (copy) of the original image (orig) is
022 * created, which is used as the source image in the subsequent filter computation. The resulting value q is placed in
023 * the original image. Notice that the border pixels remain unchanged because they are not reached by the iteration over
024 * (u,v). See Sec. 4.2 (Prog. 4.1) of [1] for additional details. The filter kernel is implicitly defined by the inner
025 * loop and has uniform weights.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
029 * (2022).
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 */
034public class Filter_Box_3x3 implements PlugInFilter {
035
036    /** Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open. */
037    public Filter_Box_3x3() {
038        if (noCurrentImage()) {
039            DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.IrishManor);
040        }
041    }
042
043    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
044        return DOES_8G;
045    }
046
047    public void run(ImageProcessor orig) {
048        final int M = orig.getWidth();
049        final int N = orig.getHeight();
050        final double W = 9;
051        ImageProcessor copy = orig.duplicate();
052
053                for (int u = 1; u <= M - 2; u++) {
054                        for (int v = 1; v <= N - 2; v++) {
055                //compute filter result for position (u, v):
056                int sum = 0;
057                for (int i = -1; i <= 1; i++) {
058                        for (int j = -1; j <= 1; j++) {
059                                                int p = copy.get(u + i, v + j);
060                        sum = sum + p;
061                    }
062                }
063                int q = (int) (sum / W);
064                                orig.set(u, v, q);
065            }
066        }
067    }
068
069}
